TENS (Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve St.Description: Uses low-frequency currents to relieve pain. Electrodes are placed on the skin in the affected area, and the current stimulates nerves, blocking pain signals and releasing endorphins.

EMS (Electrical Muscle Stimulation).Description: Applies electrical currents to provoke muscle contractions. It is used to strengthen weakened muscles, prevent muscle atrophy, and improve circulation.

Interferential Currents.Description: Uses two medium-frequency currents that intersect in the affected area, producing an interference that stimulates deeper tissues.

Galvanic Currents.Description: Uses continuous low-intensity currents to treat inflammation and stimulate blood circulation. Effective for edema treatment.

Therapeutic Ultrasound.Description: Emits high-frequency sound waves to heat deep tissues and promote cell regeneration. Often used alongside electrotherapy.

High-Frequency Currents (Microwave and S.Description: Uses high-frequency waves to heat deep tissues, improve circulation, and reduce pain.

Iontophoresis.Description: Uses continuous currents to introduce medications into the body through the skin. Useful for reducing inflammation and relieving localized pain.
